thread.title: Baltimore Pride moving to Old Goucher from Mount Vernon
thread.title_full: Baltimore Pride moving to Old Goucher from Mount Vernon

author: Wesley Case
title: Baltimore Pride moving to Old Goucher from Mount Vernon
text:
Lifestyle Baltimore Insider Baltimore Pride moving to Old Goucher from Mount Vernon 
Scenes from the 2016 Baltimore Pride parade on a hot afternoon on North Charles Street. The Gay & Lesbian Community Center of Baltimore hosts Baltimore Pride 2016 in celebration of the LGBTQ community. (Brittany Britto) 
Last year, Pride festivities occurred over eight days in July, including a parade that drew 10,000 attendees, according to the city’s fire department. 
Concerns arose over Pride’s future last year, when the GLCCB launched an online fundraising campaign to raise $15,000 for permit fees and outstanding police fees from previous festivals. Despite falling short of the goal (approximately $6,300 was raised), the festival took place as scheduled. Caption Reaching 5,000 beers at Mahaffey's Pub first 
Canton resident Joanne Barker is the first member of the beer club at Mahaffey's Pub to reach 5,000 beers. (Algerina Perna, Baltimore Sun video) 
Canton resident Joanne Barker is the first member of the beer club at Mahaffey's Pub to reach 5,000 beers. (Algerina Perna, Baltimore Sun video) Caption Pitchfork fest headliners 
LCD Soundsystem, A Tribe Called Quest and Solange will headline the Pitchfork Music Festival this summer in Chicago. (Feb. 27, 2017) 
LCD Soundsystem, A Tribe Called Quest and Solange will headline the Pitchfork Music Festival this summer in Chicago. (Feb. 27, 2017)
